said Sen. Bernie Sanders . Billions of dollars continued to flow to contractors even after they were found to have committed fraud, and about a dozen had been barred from contracting altogether. Still, the report concluded that existing remedies with respect to contractor wrongdoing are sufficient. Sen. Bernie Sanders bridles at that finding, saying "the DOD has got to be a lot more vigorous in terms of its investigations, and a lot more vigorous in prosecuting those people who have committed fraud. One of the companies on the list is Raytheon Co.'s Integrated Defense Systems, which is based in Tewksbury. The company's inclusion in the report appears to stem from a dispute over a Patriot missile

It's a smart thing to do, because you've peaked, he said. And then he advised David Letterman to not "come back like Sinatra."
